Header: Pujith Jayasundera makes a revelation at the Parliamentary Select Committee
Content: Both the then Defence Secretary Hemasiri Fnando and the former IGP Pujith Jayasungra today testified before the Special Parliamentary Select Committee. Testifying before the Special Parliamentary Select Committee appointed to look into the terrorist attacks on Easter Sunday former Inspector General Pujith Jayasundara said the then-Defense Secretary told him that President Maithripala Sirisena had wanted him not to attend the National Security Council meetings.He said the message of the President was transmitted through then Defense Secretary Hemasiri Fernando He further said the last meeting he attended was on October 23, 2018. Former Defence Secretary Hemasiri Fernando said that although the State Intelligence was under him according to the gazette, its operations were not handled by him. It was handled by the Defence Minister. As a Defence Secretary like him had no strength to changer the methodology. When talking about the Defence Secretary there is a big difference between him and Gotabhaya Rajapaksa. Mr. Rajapaksa was he unofficial Defence Minister. He was a helpless Secretary who could not at least talk to the Defence Minister. He said that there was no difference between him and other Secretaries. As a Defence Secretary he said that he had no powers.
